37978345.review:
[h1][b]如果你对这个游戏感兴趣，买之前不妨先看看我的视频了解一下[/b][/h1]
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMzE5ODI3MzYyMA==.html

非常有意思的Roguelike游戏，融合了STG飞机弹幕的元素
让你的通关之旅变的更加苛刻
进入游戏之后你会操控你的机器人去迎战黄色机器人
每个敌人各有各的特点，虽然自杀式的比较多，但是在后面放阴枪的也不少
有一个小图记忆深刻，就像闯关一样，你要迅速找到布防节奏
在节奏中快速抵达底部。突然来这么一个小关让我挺意外

再者，游戏里的道具武器非常丰富，有很多很多，还有很多可以锻造
每一片区域都有传送仪器，让你轻松解决回头路的往返
只不过如果你不了解这个武器的特点，不推荐随意购买
本人就买了很多武器，上手了才发现不合适自己

唯一可惜的是关卡太少，丰富的武器和道具反而显的太多
希望后期能多加入几关，让游戏变的更出色
如果你早早困难通关，那就试试弹幕房间吧
挑战一下眼花缭乱的子弹，看看你有多少本事吧

作为一款弹幕游戏来说，算是及格吧，Roguelike随机元素做的也很好
BOSS也各有各的特点，只可惜关卡太少，望改进

35983451.review:
I'll admit, despite my amount of playtime with this game, I didn't think much of it. I would just play it because I thought I either had nothing better to do or just wanted something to do while watching or listening to something else. But after all of my playtime, I eventually realized why I kept coming back to this particular game and why it's one of my most-played games on Steam. That reason: It's legitimately one of the best third-person shooters out there.

Which doesn't seem to be the case on the surface, as the environments, though randomized for each playthrough, are mundane and generally constant. That can deceive the average viewer into thinking the gameplay itself is just as mundane as the environment, and it's anything but. Through my time playing in very Early Access to now (still in Early Access, but after many updates), I've witnessed a variety of both major and minor changes, and each update has generally improved the gameplay, and even if more problems are introduced they're typically solved fairly quickly, and some aren't really problems anyway. I've seen even people who otherwise really like the game harp on the most minor, nothing bull crap, and though there were times I've disagreed, it has led to the game only improving as time goes on anyway since the developer does actually listen to players.

To be exact, it's not just the randomized map layouts and bosses which provide the fun, nor is it the variety of weapons and add-ons you can apply, all of which actually perform vastly different functions and thus provide to each player's tastes (and new items have been added every so often to boot). It's the balance this game has with its leveling system compared to the enemies and rooms you encounter. It's how you encounter so many enemies in a room without feeling overwhelmed by everything at once, and even when you're overwhelmed it feels challenging rather than frustrating or ridiculous. It's the satisfaction you get when you slowly discover more items and what you can do with them along the way, as it's rare you get much of anything at once. There's even a level of strategy with how and what you want to level up and when as often you can only do one thing or the other. Should one buy a health upgrade before the boss, or buy the probe sensor so your probe weapons can fire on it as well? Or at least that's something you can contemplate if you happen to have purchased the map and know where the boss is, which means you can seek out the other rooms available beforehand and find more chances at obtaining items or experience points. Otherwise, you'd have to rely on your instinct and sometimes just pick something to upgrade or purchase before moving to the next room, boss or no boss (but especially for just in case there is a boss), and it's easy enough to do considering you can teleport from anywhere you are to anywhere you've been already.

Essentially, there's a serious polish to this game to the point where a lot of what many players can take for granted nowadays is thoroughly exemplified here. It's not big, it's not extravagant, it's not epic, it doesn't need to be any of those things. Even if other games within this same mold have more customization options or better graphics or even better level degisn or aesthetic touches, they have those merits but they don't have all of the solid fundamentals this game has. A game like Tetris is extremely popular and well-loved by virtue of just being simple and well-made, and that's what this is, and thus shows that sometimes that's all you need. I'm not saying this game should be considered an all-time great game like Tetris, but I still wouldn't have any qualms about saying it's the best isometric third-person roguelike shooter out there, and it's only getting better.

36305154.review:
Simple but addictive twin stick shooter. It has all the fun of destroying hoards of robots, plus a stripped down rpg mechanic for upgrading all the various weapons you find. The presentation may seem a little minimalist, but it helps to see what is what when things get hectic. 

The main challenge for me was figuring out how the weapon system works. There are about 5 different types of utility slots: main weapon, sub-weapon, drone, boost and enhancement modules. Its a little daunting at first, but if you stick with it the game does a good job of telling you what everything does.

I've been enjoying it a lot, even in its unfinished state and despite a few crashes. I've played around 30 hours and it has crashed about 5 times so far, but the author seems to be working hard to update the bugs. Not the most in-depth game out there, but hey - I'm just here to kill robots and grab power-ups, so its definitely been worth the price tag for me.

36260358.review: I really love this game and would love to see how it progresses. This is a game I go to when i'm bored out of my mind and wanna chill. The soundtrack is what makes this game what it is and then the levelling system is calming and thrilling at the same time. Great game thank you for creating it!

36042320.review: This game is exceptional, even in its present EA state. The graphics are simple, the music is great (I like chiptunes), the gameplay seems pretty basic and elements of the UI seem obtuse. What's so good about it? The fact is that the game makes playing well so fun because you can get such wonderful combinations of items. I just cleared my first map and completed a playthrough successfully by relying on a great drone and my level 3 dash blade which allowed me to wreck enemies and their bullets alike.

38828862.review:
[b][i]Rush Rover[/i] is okay enough.[/b] Do you need this in your library next to games like [i]Monolith[/i], [i]Isaac[/i], [i]Gungeon[/i], [i]Starward Rogue[/i], [i]Neon Chrome[/i], [i]Nuclear Throne[/i], [i]NeuroVoider[/i], [i]Runers[/i], and so on? [b]No, you don't.[/b] All of those games are much better and much more original.

The problem I see with [i]Rush Rover[/i] is that it has an extremely slow start. I'm sure it's due to some combination of 1) bullet spongey enemies, 2) rooms that are too big, and 3) you move too slow. If you change two of those three, the problem would likely be fixed.

What I do like is the upgrade system. It feels beefy and changes things. Also, I've found some really cool guns that made me feel OP. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Price-to-content ratio is good
+Controller support works well

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Make sure you've exhausted the games I listed in the intro here first, because there is nothing to [i]Rush Rover[/i] that hasn't [i]really[/i] been done before
-The artwork and chiptune music is pretty 'meh' to me
-The start is too slow and easy

[b]This is not a 'gem' as much as a competent clone in a flood of rogueish games.[/b] I don't mean that disrespectfully, but I have to call it as I see it.

38816925.review: Solid, streamlined, and fun.  Took me about an hour to beat it once, but I was far from perfecting all the bosses and unlocking all the cool weapons this game has to offer.  For five bucks, it's well worth it.

38634188.review: Very fun game. Gameplay is solid and randomly generated map keeps it interesting. Enemy, boss, and area design are well done. Beautiful art style in general. Takes about 45 minutes to complete a run. Only downside is that music is pretty unsatisfying, but I just turn music off in settings and listen to something else instead. For 5 dollars, would highly reccomend. Is a refreshing break from other roguelike games and I would like to see a sequel.

38227780.review: 挺不错的roguelike游戏，有点像挺进地牢，但是设定在一个未来科技的背景。

38203352.review:
到现在为止本作已经基本完成了，质量还是和当初一样的高！十分推荐喜欢TPS游戏和Roguelike游戏的玩家来试试。这游戏太棒了简直。

本作采用了2D顶视射击视角进行游戏。游戏包含了随机地图生成Rougelike元素、独特的武器和装备设计、多样化的敌人以及刺激的BOSS战斗，当然还融合了传统射击游戏的经典元素“弹幕躲避”。游玩过后我给本作总体评分至少在95分以上。

1，故事系统：本作设定在末日后的废土世界，未来人工智能的发展，使得智能机械勘探开采普及到了各个星系。随之而来的就是这些勘探机器人独立意识的崛起，机械在完成了对人类的独立战争之后，其中高智能机械开始了对同类机械的“I格式化”，企图控制所有的机器人。玩家超控了一位未被“格式化”的矿机，拿起武器，在这场机甲大战中冲出一条活路。于是，我们的冒险就此开始！整体上故事的代入感还是很足的，在游玩过程中可能会随机看到一些死掉的先行者遗体碎片，废弃的矿脉，还有一些先进的改造机械。这些都能让人感受到其独特的世界观架构！

2，装备系统：本作我玩了27个小时了（其中17个小时是在方块游戏平台上玩的），几十种独特风格的武器和探机（装备列表显示好像是一共有三四十种吧），再加上技能多样，刷起怪来简直遛到飞起。我最喜欢的搭配就是激光枪+雷电机器人+冲击钻技能，三者配合简直堪称完美。激光枪一条线扫射而且射程远，很多时候在敌人的视野范围外就先灭敌人了，雷电机器人附带麻痹效果，可以使敌人减速，这样它们就更加追不上我了，如果敌人过多就用冲击钻开路，然后加速跑出包围圈。

3，画面和音效：这几年的Roguelike类游戏基本上都是暗黑的哥特式地下城探险风格，本作算是一股清流了，本作是复古的类银河战士风格，抛开了常见Roguelike类游戏的压抑感，而且科技感十足；与之相配合的，音乐也采用了上世纪流行的8bit的芯片音效，配合上画面简直穿越了。

4，游戏系统：游玩中各个关卡的敌人是随机的，每关都是有强有弱，看人品。Boss也是本作的一大特色，每一个Boss都有自己的特点，而且Boss刷出来是随机的，所以更加令人期待不是吗。今天在第四关发现了一个先驱者的遗骸，得到了一个武器插槽，这个设定很像黑魂和尼尔机械纪元里面的设定，后来者可以得到前人在此留下的财富。这个设定极大丰富了游戏玩法和内涵。不知道开发组会不会在游戏正式发售时把这个功能加强。
游戏难度方面当然也是随机的，看人品啦。所以拜托系统都给点好枪，少刷点强力怪也是一个乐趣呀。

5，BUG方面：开局一段时间后，一般在十几关后内存占用会非常多，造成卡顿；这是重启会恢复正常。

6，建议：
首先建议恢复地图上的关卡标号，因为显示着第几关更容易调整战术。
其次就是血条的部分，现在开局就是半管血，而且也加不满，强迫症看着想要砸显示器。

38159380.review:

是剧情杀还是bug啊？

38142429.review:
It's 5 bucks, I'd have easily paid 10 or more.  Slick little game, super tight controls.  Has great top-down shoot em up action.  I love the rogulike elements, the variety of enemies and the deep customization. 

Only gripe is the sound.  It is solid where it counts (shooting feels impactful and satisfying), but a couple of the weapon sounds are rather annoying to hear all game.  Music could use more variety too.  But on the flip side, it IS a 5 dollar game.

Localization can be spotty, some of the english is broken and some descriptions seem to be missing.  But noting that will really hurt your gameplay, you'll figure it all out easily.

It's not a perfect game, but it IS a perfect way to kill some time in an enjoyable manner.  

TL;DR: Great shooting, great design, mostly great presentation.

38104476.review:
乍一看看画面，《Rush Rover》是非常不起眼的，游戏中大部分地面和墙壁都是一种善乏可陈的土灰色，既不酷炫又不精致——让人只能无奈调侃一句：或许这就是机器人审美的世界。在游戏中，我们操控一只采矿型的小机器人，因为某些原因独自对抗大量的敌对机器人，可惜如此一番简单的设定背景也只能在游戏之外的简介中看到。在画面色彩和故事情节这两方面，哪怕在一干良莠不齐的独立游戏中，本作也可以说仅仅是一只小弱鸡。

另一方面，当玩家打开这个独立小游戏后，又很容易被节奏感极强的音乐、特效和射击感俘获，沉浸于游戏内容本身。我们的战场是机器人统治的世界，敌人散布在地图各个角落，清理完一房间的敌人后解锁下一个房间。我们的目标是且战且变强，顺便斩获五个BOSS直至清到地图终点——或者横尸在BOSS的身下。菜单中陈列的各色BOSS总共有十六个，这仅是随机元素之一，包括多样的装备、收集品、升级和兑换，以及随机的房间地图和BOSS战在内，其丰富程度填满一个类Rough小游戏绰绰有余。而弹幕元素极大程度地包含在战斗特别是BOSS战中，也设置了独立的“弹幕模式”，简单粗暴地满足弹幕爱好者的胃口。

🎮 总评

《Rush Rover》极像是一个偏科严重的学生，这个独立小游戏专注于游戏核心的设计，在关卡和弹幕挑战上可挑剔的余地不多，配上流畅的手感、多样的道具、极强风格的音乐，足以让类Rough和弹幕嗜好者得到一段激爽的游戏体验。遗憾的是缺少个性的画面和贫乏的剧本创作让它难以吸引到太多玩家的关注。

🎮 一个影响新手体验的地方

游戏中的大部分道具在菜单UI中没有明确的名称和说明，作为标识的像素图小得难以辨识，这些道具只有落在地图上才显示名称，所以熟悉一段时间将各类物品爆个遍后，才能大致了解本作的道具系统。

38060146.review: 玩的游戏不多，但是很喜欢这样的像素风的游戏，目前困难模式第18名，小小的开心一下。原力标感觉很有意思，近战很强，火箭发射器自动锁敌，但是攻击间隔以及伤害上的确不如其他武器，其他暂时不评价，了解还不够 。爆设计图要运气，一把困难全BOSS都很难出一张图，不知道有没有肝帝能集齐，233333。然后现在很想试一试的双线程，都通关8次左右了，没见着一次。期待后续会有更多的武器，更难的难度，以及联机模式，跟队友抢装备，233333。

37978513.review:
整体来说推荐入手。
以下是对后续版本的期待
1. 作为roguelike来讲，随机性还不够。目前的流程基本就是打一样的小怪，再被一样的BOSS锤死。
2. 武器很丰富，图纸很多，但是太难获取了，通关流程下来也就换2、3把武器吧，而位移技能（似乎只有闪烁？）和小机器人要么扎堆要么没有。
3. 因为无损通关会有奖励，所以不光是近战武器鸡肋，射程稍近的武器也都不大好使。
4.作为正式版来讲，内容还不够多。
